column5: ...  Since I hab a colb and am not going fishing today..  I'm sitting in my {new to me saying for basement} "Man Cave" and looking around and wondering if anyone else has "permission" from their wife to claim such a space in the house to call their own.  I had a 2 bedroom apartment in the basement of my house.. a few years back we decided to not rent it out anymore..  I then had room to decorate it at will with all my stuff and build a little bar.  The only stipulation my wife has .."No Brass Poles"  A few pics..           RFS
That is a dope hang out!  I especially like the flame job on that trout?
It's an old 25" Rainbow filled with cement must be 40 years old all the paint was flaking off so I decided to flame it.     RFS
How much to rent it?  I will still let you hang out there.  You can have your own key.
I had one.....I displayed over 3000 sports autographs......it's now the baby's room and the collection is stored in the basement!
Super Randy J'aime bien ce coin la     Pas mal COOL!!!   I'm sure you're going to have many great gathering down there Merci de partager!!! Jacques

I've got my own "man cave" as well, but its not as cool as yours with all the stuffed fish etc. lol....  I have my computer, tv, one 90gal and three 75gal aquariums double stacked, pull out couch, bathroom with shower.... all I need is a bar fridge and hot plate and I can live done here!!!  Burt
Nice cave, but that poker set is gonna need a bigger table to call home  No cave here yet, the kids have a lot of growing to do before I can claim the basement as my own

The wall where the Muskie and Artie The Antelope hang is coming down before spring.... this will add another 15' to the cave... I already have plans for a poker table and a pool table and a more masculine paint scheme.
Sweet jesus man, nice cave for sure! Where is the couch for the rest of to sit on when we come over to watch WFN and play pool?  Also when are installing the beer tap on the bar?
Now that is a nice cave, mine is currently under renovations.
I used to have one of those. But then I went fishing with 2Rs for a few days and my wife sold it. Now we live in a condo. No mancaves allowed.  JF

I've got one. It started with my leather couch, a bar, a beer fridge, my big screen with surround sound, my computer and all my fishing gear. Now it is my computer, big screen, some gear and a hell of a lot of kids toys.  BTW I am currently in my "Man Cave" watching a Berenstein Bears Movie!
Nice set of aquariums outside.  Some great looking sheds too.  Do I see a pen for raising pheasant?
My entire house is a "Man Cave" of sorts since I've been single.  But I am currently renovating the basement and hope to end up have something as man cozy as that Randy.
just getting started on mine, gonna be old barn siding and outdoors all the way.  jason
